newsitem.title: USA: Northern States Minn. coal unit up by Sept.
newsitem.headline: Northern States Minn. coal unit up by Sept.

text.p: Northern States Power Co said its 176 megawatt (MW) Black Dog coal-fired power unit 4 in Minnesota is expected to resume production near the end of August after shutting down Aug 21 for repairs.
"It should be back up close to the end of the month," company spokeswoman Jean Hammer said Thursday.
Details on the nature of repairs needed at the unit were unavailable, Hammer said.
The unit is one of four at the Black Dog plant, which has a total production capacity of 461 MW. The plant is located in Burnsville, just south of Minneapolis, Minn.
